Configuring Service Profile Template

With a service profile template, you can create several service profiles with the same basic parameters, such as the number of vNICs and vHBAs, and with identity information drawn from the same pools. This template is considered as a logical server.

To configure service profile template, perform the following:

 1. Select the Organization from the drop-down list. By default, root is displayed.

 2. Enter the Number of Service Profile Template in the textbox and click Add to generate service profile template. You can use this service profile template to reboot or boot the Server.

Figure 7-24 Service Profile Template

Note • Initial Template: Any service profiles created from this template are not updated if the template changes.

 • Updating Template: Any service profiles created from this template are updated if the template changes.

 3. Click template to edit and modify the required fields and then click Save.

Figure 7-25 Edit Template

Table 7-14 Template Parameters

Fields

Description

Name

Name of the template

Description

Description of the template

Template Type

Initial Template or Updating Template

Boot Policy

Select the boot policy from drop-down to boot the server

Server Pool

Select the server pool from drop-down to pool the server

Local Disk Policy

Select the local disk from drop-down to configure local disk

SAN Connectivity Policy

Select the SAN connectivity from drop-down to connect the server

vHBA

Select the vHBA from the drop-down to connect to the Virtual Host Bus Adapter.

WWNN Pool

Select the WWNN Pool from the drop-down to connect to WWNN

vNIC Template

Select the vNIC Template from drop-down to connect to the Virtual Interface Card.

UUID

Select the UUID from the drop-down to connect to the UUID.

Hostfirmware Package

Select the Hostfirmware Package from the drop-down to connect to the Hostfirmware Package.

BIOS Policy

Select the BIOS Policy from the drop-down.

Maintenance Policy

Select the Maintenance Policy from the drop-down.

Organizations

Select the Organizations from the drop-down.

 4. Click Save and Next to proceed further.
